laboratory_examinations.findings: Opening pressure of 11 cm H2O; CSF cultures negative; two white blood cells present.
Marked mid-line shift in the direction opposite the craniectomy site with subfalcine herniation and effacement of the peripontine cisterns.
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: Follow-up brain CT scan confirmed resolution of the tissue shifts and herniation.

laboratory_examinations.findings: Serum glucose 240 mg/dL attributable to dextrose bolus; all other results normal.
Serum transaminases slightly elevated; ALT 46 U/L (normal <40 U/L).
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: ALT increased to 160 U/L after several days.

laboratory_examinations.findings: Plasma ammonia fluctuating from 155 to 60 to 102 µmol/L; normal range <150 µmol/L.
Characteristic biochemical abnormalities of multiple acyl-CoA dehydrogenation deficiency; confirmed by urine organic acids analysis.
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: Normalization of biochemical abnormalities after treatment.

laboratory_examinations.findings: Myopathic pattern not observed; positive sharp waves in deltoid muscles.
Complete bilateral vision loss occurred during straining episodes; visual examinations normal after episodes.
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: Follow-up after high-dose prednisone showed no further vision loss.
